data.title: Just like Chinatown in New York, San Francisco love it
data.text: this place is excellent. consistantly fresh & tasty. Great menu with lots of sleection I just wish the daily board was in English

data.title: Excellent Cash Only Place
data.text:
I highly suggest the BBQ pork wonton soup with the ramen noodles. I have had various dishes that were just yummy. My husband usually heads towards the spicer dishes such as orange beef or spicy style. My mother in law usually gets the pork soft noodle with roasted pork.

This place is cash only.

data.title: Team Dinner
data.text: Very small restaurant that was very big in hospitality and flavor. It is nothing to look at from the outside, but just inside the door you see the beautiful BBQ ducks and sausage hanging ready and you know you have come to the right place. They do not sell alcohol, but were fine with BYOB. A great time was had by all.

data.title: Food was great
data.text:
My wife and I had an hour to kill before an appointment in Dallas so we decided to stop by this place for lunch.  Upon entering, the place looked so much like the one in North Richland Hills (furniture, etc) so we figured it's the same owner since the names are the same.

I ordered the Beef Stew Wonton Noodle Soup and my wife ordered the Wonton Noodle Soup.  She also saw a delicious looking plate at the next table so she ordered the same.  It was called the Hot Pot.

While we found the arrangement of the tables quite crammed up, we still enjoyed our lunch.  The soup was not as price economical as the restaurant we regularly visit at Arlington (King Chinese BBQ) as it was about $2 more but it was delicious as well.

We were utterly surprised when paying because as we handed the waitress the check along with my wife's credit card, she was rebuffed with three words, "Cash only please."  I had to ask her a couple of times to confirm if indeed she meant that we couldn't pay with the card and she replied with the same four words, "Cash only please."

My wife had brought about $30 in singles so we had to embarrassingly count enough to pay the bill which was about $26+.

Parking during lunch can be very difficult as the lot is very small.

data.title: One of the best Chinese restaurants, but cash only.
data.text:
This place is one of our favorites.  There are several in the Dallas area, all delightful.  This is not an Americanized Chinese eatery.  Asian customers outnumber non-Asians about eight to one,  The only concession to American styles is the size of the portions.  Typically one dish will feed two people, especially if you add an appetizer.  Two dishes will feed three people easily.  However, if you are really hungry, you might handle one solo.  I see a lot of take-home boxes when I visit.
The food itself is wonderful, full of flavor and prepared by a first rate cook.  Prices are very reasonable and value is outstanding.  The place is clean and well lit.  Noise level depends on the crowd, but is typically satisfactory even when busy.  Service is satisfactory.  The nearest thing to a negative is that they don't accept credit cards or checks.  Bring cash, but you won't need too much.

data.title: Frequent flyer
data.text: Been here man years. They do serve pretty nice food. Place remain small and true Chinese style food.

data.title: Great BBQ
data.text: We've eaten here many times and enjoy it. Our favorite is the roast duck. Bring cash as no credit cards taken!

data.title: The best in Dallas
data.text: If you want real authentic Chines food - this is the place.  If your looking for an upscale atmosphere  this is not the place.  The food is incredibly fresh, consistent and delicious.  This place has been around for several years - a must for those who like Chines food.

data.title: Huge variety of goodness
data.text: This is my favorite Chinese restaurant in Richardson.  They have awesome duck!!!!  You can buy a roasted duck or half a duck to take home as well.  It's also BYOB and cash only.  Everything is so good!  I love the Chinese broccoli and mushrooms too!  The waitresses aren't overly friendly if you are not Chinese, don't let that stop you though!  It's worth the visit!

data.title: Real Chinese food...
data.text: If you wan to eat real and fresh chinese food... here we are... Dim sum is good and hot tea to wash it down...  Cash only accepted....

data.title: A disappointment
data.text: I read the reviews so had high expectations. The shrimp won ton soup was good and so was the barbecue pork. The seafood hot pot contained very little seafood and had imitation crab instead of the real thing. All of the other dishes were mediocre so we won't be returning.

data.title: Want fabulous Chinese in Dallas? You've arrived.
data.text: First off, a couple of caveats: my husband is Chinese so he is VERY picky about his Chinese restaurants. He and I met in Dallas and he introduced me (and my family and friends) to FCB. Also, we have lived in most parts of the U.S. where you would expect to find excellent and authentic Chinese food (except for the Northwest). Now for the review: Hands down, this is our absolute favorite Chinese restaurant. The only place that can top it is Yank Sing in the Financial District in SF, and that's only for dim sum (like comparing apples and...pears). FCB (both Garland and Richardson locations) offers top notch Chinese dishes, some with a French or Vietnamese flair as the owners are Vietnamese. Take for example the Parmesan-Crusted Prawns: heaven on a plate. And we always order more than one plate because everyone loves it. The Tangerine Beef: tender steak with a sticky-sweet sauce that you will want to dip everything in. Be sure to order it spicy. Salt-and--Pepper Shrimp: delicious and tender prawns with the perfect crunch and amount of chiles. The Shrimp Wonton Noodle Soup: oh man - so good on a cold evening. Okay, so they don't take credit cards. Who cares? And exactly what type of "sides" do you really expect to find in a Chinese restaurant? Mashed potatoes? You get RICE. WHITE RICE if you're really going native. If you need a side, order some of those heavenly Garlic String Beans. The are the perfect accompaniment to every dish. And don't forget Pan-Fried Noodles. Oh brother. Soooo delicious! (House version is best but Chicken is pretty darned awesome as well.)

data.title: Good Chinese food.  No nonsense
data.text: This is my favorite type of Chinese restaurant, no frills, roasted meat hanging on the windows.  Authentic and inexpensive.  You can't leave the place hungry and broke, unless you went in broke to begin with...

data.title: Bring Cash!
data.text:
5 of us from work went here today for lunch based on reviews. We were not overly excited about the food, no appetizers, no sides other than a bowl of rice. Nothing was explained on ordering or choices. One of us asked for very spicy fried rice, it was bland. We were presented with a bowl of soup, a bowl of rice and 5 soup bowls....we assumed it was an appetizer and started to serve from it, then the rest of our meals were also presented family style, we then realized the soup was what one of us had ordered...so why 5 bowls....

We were ok with the food, not thrilled, we were getting up to leave and all had our debit cards in our hands and the waitress says cash only! We said excuse me? Where does it say that? She pointed to the register to a 3x4 card that said cash only. 2 of us had cash, she told the others to walk across the street to the gas station ATM.

If there was a large sign to read on the way in indicating they're a cash only business, that would be fine, but to surprise people with it after the bland food has been consumed? Bad business.

Thankfully one person had enough to cover the entire bill.....we will never go back there again!

data.title: Don't go for the ambiance, go for the great food...
data.text:
As my title says - Don't go for the ambiance, go for the great food.  This a no frills, CASH ONLY, hole-in-the wall Chinese restaurant.  The highlights are the Shrimp Crispy Noodle and of course the BBQ Pork and BBQ Duck.  

If you are looking for a P.F. Chang's experience, then don't go to First Chinese BBQ.  If you are looking for authentic Chinese BBQ, then this is the place.

data.title: good roast duck, easy quick meal
data.text: We went there for lunch and had the roast duck, vegetables and wonton. Good quick meal. Located close to all other chinese restaurants, parking was easy.

data.title: Great Place
data.text: I have been going here for a long time. Great BBQ pork and soy sauce chicken. The duck is awesome too. Lots of Dallas Chefs go here on their day off. Ask your server whats on the special board and maybe try one of those dishes too (Curry Chicken fried rice, Crispy steak or basil chicken) They only take cash and the place is small.

data.title: Food is decent, they have a limited menu
data.text: No appetisers, basic menu, but taste was fine.   THe parking lot is a bit tricky and tight.   I recommend parking elsewhere and walking if you don't want door dings.

data.title: Great cantonese food
data.text: This is a great local, very casual, Chinese restaurant.  My favorite is the roasted duck on rice, however the bbq pork is good too.

data.title: Okay Chinese .. Not what I was expecting though
data.text: I went with my hubby because of the reviews of this place from many outlets. I guess I had high hopes. The duck was good to me. My hubby said the BBQ pork and chicken were good but he didn't care for the duck, flavor was too strong. Not much ambiance. Price was good. But I was expecting to be wowed and I wasn't. Also, they are CASH ONLY.  They only have a very small sign stating that. I wish I had known when I went because we had to go across the street to the ATM to pay for our food. Okay Chinese. Don't believe the hype.
